This is a matter of having it clear about implementation doing
this.setStyle("display", "");
before animation. This practically means ``q('#foo').fadeIn()`` won't work on initially (with CSS style, not style attribute) hidden with ``#foo {display: none}`` element. So additional ``show`` invocation is needed.
As-is: - hidden in style: q('#foo').fadeIn().show() - hidden in attr: q('#foo').fadeIn()
If we remove the line: - hidden in style: q('#foo').show().fadeIn() - hidden in attr: q('#foo').show().fadeIn()
First case looks counter-intuitive and inconsistent. If we take ``fadeIn`` and ``fadeOut`` just a shortcuts for animation, second case is reasonable as we show something previously hidden, than fade it. Then a note is needed in the API Doc.
If we don't take ``fadeIn`` and ``fadeOut`` just as shortcuts, the way jQuery handles it, some visibility checks should be implemented.
